Test Case Name: Verify API health check returns success
Test Steps: 1. Send GET request to /api/health | 2. Verify response status 200 | 3. Validate response structure
Validation Points: Status code is 200 | Response is valid JSON | success field is true | message equals 'API is running' | timestamp is present and not empty | Response time < 1000ms

Test Case Name: Verify system health returns all data files status
Test Steps: 1. Send GET request to /api/system/health | 2. Verify response status 200 | 3. Validate all data files | 4. Validate metrics
Validation Points: Status code is 200 | Response is valid JSON | success is true | status is 'healthy' | All data_files values are 'ok' | metrics contains total_orders/total_products/total_users | timestamp present | Response time < 1000ms

Test Case Name: Verify API documentation returns all endpoints
Expected Response Fields: success=true | title='E-Commerce API Documentation' | endpoints={} | total_endpoints | version | features=[]
Test Steps: 1. Send GET request to /api/docs | 2. Verify response status 200 | 3. Validate structure
Validation Points: Status code is 200 | Response is valid JSON | success is true | title is 'E-Commerce API Documentation' | version present | base_url starts with http | total_endpoints > 0 | endpoints object has categories | features array not empty

Test Case Name: Verify user registration with valid data
Test Steps: 1. Generate random email | 2. Send POST with user data | 3. Verify status 201 | 4. Validate response
Validation Points: Status code is 201 | Response is valid JSON | success is true | message equals 'User registered successfully' | data.id is number | data.email matches input | data.name matches input | data.is_admin is false | created_at is timestamp | No password in response

Test Case Name: Verify registration fails with duplicate email
Test Steps: 1. Use existing email | 2. Send POST request | 3. Verify error
Validation Points: Status code is 409 | Response is valid JSON | success is false | error indicates duplicate email

Test Case Name: Verify registration fails with missing required fields
Test Steps: 1. Send POST with incomplete data | 2. Verify validation error
Validation Points: Status code is 400 | Response is valid JSON | success is false | error indicates missing fields

Test Case Name: Verify user login with valid credentials
Expected Response Fields: success=true | message='Login successful' | token | refresh_token | user={id,email,name,is_admin}
Test Steps: 1. Send POST with valid credentials | 2. Verify status 200 | 3. Validate tokens | 4. Save tokens
Validation Points: Status code is 200 | Response is valid JSON | success is true | message is 'Login successful' | token present and not empty | refresh_token present | Both tokens are JWT format | user object has id/email/name/is_admin

Test Case Name: Verify login fails with invalid password
Test Steps: 1. Send POST with wrong password | 2. Verify error
Validation Points: Status code is 401 | Response is valid JSON | success is false | error indicates invalid credentials | No token returned

Test Case Name: Verify login fails with non-existent user
Test Steps: 1. Send POST with non-existent email | 2. Verify error
Validation Points: Status code is 401 | Response is valid JSON | success is false | error indicates invalid credentials  | No token returned

Test Case Name: Verify admin login with valid credentials
Expected Response Fields: success=true | message='Login successful' | token | refresh_token | user={is_admin=true}
Test Steps: 1. Send POST with admin credentials | 2. Verify status 200 | 3. Validate admin flag | 4. Save tokens
Validation Points: Status code is 200 | Response is valid JSON | success is true | user.is_admin is true | Both tokens present and valid JWT | Token saved for admin operations

Test Case Name: Verify token refresh with valid refresh token
Pre-Conditions: User logged in with refresh token
Test Steps: 1. Use valid refresh token | 2. Send POST to refresh | 3. Verify new token returned
Validation Points: Status code is 200 | Response is valid JSON | success is true | message is 'Token refreshed successfully' | New token present | New token is valid JWT

Test Case Name: Verify refresh fails with invalid token
Expected Response Fields: success=false | error='Invalid or expired refresh token'
Test Steps: 1. Send POST with invalid token | 2. Verify error
Validation Points: Status code is 401 | Response is valid JSON | success is false | error indicates invalid token

Test Case Name: Verify refresh fails without refresh token
Test Steps: 1. Send POST without refresh token | 2. Verify error
Validation Points: Status code is 400 | Response is valid JSON | success is false | error indicates missing token

  "message": "Order status updated successfully",
    "success": true

pending :

    "success": false
shipped:
"message": "Order status updated successfully",
    "success": true
delivered:

Test Case Name: Verify check review status before and after reviewing
